definition: afraid of the head, terrified of the tail (idiom); ever fearful and nervous/afraid of the slightest thing
to fear
head/chief/first (occasion, thing etc)/classifier for poems, songs etc
to fear
horse's tail/pointed posterior section of a locust etc
tail/remainder/remnant/extremity/sixth of the 28 constellations/classifier for fish

sentences.english: She accused the government of a cowardly surrender to big-business interests.
sentences.chinese: 她指責政府畏首畏尾屈從於大企業的利益。

sentences.english: We should not be overcautious or too afraid of reactionaries sneaking in.
sentences.chinese: 不要畏首畏尾，懼怕反動分子混進來。

sentences.english: The kids growing up in fears will be flinched in future.
sentences.chinese: 恐懼中長大的孩子，將來容易畏首畏尾。

sentences.english: The UN's member-nations can no longer afford to pussyfoot around the issue.
sentences.chinese: 聯合國會員再也經不起畏首畏尾。

definition: to look forward and back/to consider prudently/overcautious
lit. to fear the wolf in front and the tiger behind (idiom)/fig. to be full of needless fears/reds under the beds
pinyin: qian2 pa4 lang2 hou4 pa4 hu3

definition: to shrink back in fear (idiom); too cowardly to advance
bound hand and foot (idiom); constrained
to stand still without advancing (idiom); to hesitate and hold back
timid/gutless/weakling
to worry about personal gains and losses
indecisive/irresolute
chicken-hearted (idiom)/gutless
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); at a loss/in a hopeless situation
timid/weak
cavalier/offhand/reckless
to shrink back as the time for battle approaches (idiom)/to get cold feet
hesitancy/indecision/to waver
to hesitate to move forward/to hesitate/to hold back
hesitant to take action
